That's great! Here are some tips for a beginner learning to play saxophone:

1. Start with the basics: Before you start playing songs, focus on the basics like proper posture, hand positioning, and breathing techniques. It's essential to get these right from the beginning to avoid developing bad habits.

2. Learn to read music: Learning to read music is vital for any instrument, saxophone included. Familiarize yourself with music terminology and the staff notation system.

3. Practice regularly: Regular practice is key to improving your skills. Try to practice every day, even if it's just for a short time.

4. Listen to saxophone music: Listen to different types of saxophone music to develop a better understanding of the instrument's capabilities and style.

5. Get a good teacher: A good teacher can provide you with guidance, feedback, and support to help you improve your technique and stay motivated.

6. Have fun: Lastly, remember to have fun! Playing an instrument should be an enjoyable experience, so don't be too hard on yourself and enjoy the learning process.

I hope these tips help you on your saxophone journey. Good luck and have fun!
